name: Killdream.GitHub.io
body: ### Welcome to GitHub Pages. This automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here [using GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/), select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new `gh-pages` branch locally. If you’re using GitHub Desktop, simply sync your repository and you’ll see the new branch. ### Designer Templates Turbo Vision : ChgMnuB1.pas : This program demonstrates of how to have changing menu bars during program run time. ColorDmo.pas : A simple program showing how to save and load changes made to the color palette by a user. DlgDmo.pas : One basic example on the creation/use of dialog boxes. EdPrint.pas : this demonstration shows how to print the contents of an active PEditWindow. ExecIt.pas : this demonstration shows how to execute DOS commands from within a TApplicaiton. FillDemo.pas : A sample program demonstating the monitoring of a PInputline. This program fills the value of another input line based upon a previously inputed value in an inputline. HistDmo1.pas : This program is an example of using a PHistoryBox that already contains items in the list. No additional items may be added to the history list. HistDmo2.pas : This program is an example of using a PHistoryBox that already contains default items in the list. Additional items may be added to the history list. ListDemo.pas : This is a short demonstration on the usage of basic List Boxes. ListBox2.pas : This program is a demonstration on the ability to quick find an item in a ListBox. Pressing a character will bring you to the first item with that character as the begining character. ListBox3.pas : This program is a demonstration on the ability to select an item from a ListBox by double clicking the mouse button on the item. The item may also be selected by highlighting the item and selecting item. ListBox4.pas : This program is a demonstration on the ability to select an item from a ListBox by pressing character keys, and the 'string' pressed will bring to the closest element with those characters in order. The item may also be selected by highlighting the item and selecting item. MultStat.pas : This is a demonstration of multiple status lones within an application. MyPBDemo.pas : This is a demonstration of a progress box, to show the percentage completed of a certain action. MyPBDmo2.pas : This is another demonstration of a progress box, to show the percentage completed of a certain action. OutTest.pas : This is a demonstration of the usage a TOutline. OutTest2.pas : This is a more complex demonstration of the usage a TOutline. PassDlg.pas : A demonstration of a password inputline. The keys pressed are not echoed to the inputline, a mask character is. PBDemo3.pas : This is another demonstration of a progress box, to show the percentage completed of a certain action. RtMouse.pas : This is a demonstration of how to activate a local menu by pressing the right mouse button. RZFGen.pas and RZFload.pas: These files display the usage and structure of resource files. To properly utilize, you must have both programs. TermDemo.pas : This sample program is a demonstration of a Terminal Window. TxtInsrt.pas : This sample program is a demonstration of inserting a predefined text string into an editor window. Pascal : ASCii.pas : A program demonstrating a text based menu, this also displays an ASCii table to the monitor. Donated by Greg Touchton AsmGDT.pas : A demonstration of how to get a files date and time attribute using ASM under Pascal. Async.pas : This ASYNC unit implements a >COMPLETE< multi-port serial interface wrapped in a turbo pascal object. Baud rates up to 110,000 are supported. Average.pas : A sample program that calculates the high, low and average within a numerical data set. Basic.pas : A unit containing useful functions. Donated by Jolly Roger BlakJack.pas : A simple blackJack game. Donated by Greg Touchton BublSort.pas : A demonstration of the Bubble Sorting algorithm. CollDmo2.pas : another more detailed sample demonstrating collections and their properties. ComX.pas : a very basic telecommunications program. DayWeek.pas : a sample program that will calculate the day of week a particular date occurs. DblLnk1.pas : a sample program showing the usage of a non-sorted double linked list. DblLnk2.pas : a sample program showing the usage of a sorted double linked list. DotSpin.pas : a demonstration of rotating pixels mode 10h. Donated by Deluvian FdFstNxt.pas : a small demonstration of FindFirst and FindNext. Fractal.pas : This is a sample Fractal Generator. Donated by Sacha Chua IntDemo.pas : A TSR program showing a basic example of creating a TSR and utilizing interrupts. ( System Timer interrupt) IntDemo2.pas : Another TSR program showing a basic example of creating a TSR utilizing interrupts. ( keyboard interrupt) MemWrite.pas : A sample showing direct writing to video memory. MF_Tut01.pas : Tutorial #1 by MintyFrsh on Mode 13h graphics programming. MyUnit.pas : Unit that contains very useful miscellaneous procedures and functions to perform a variety of actions. NewGame.pas : The game Roulette ( requires Text97.pas and Mouse95.pas to play). Donated by Greg Touchton PutImg.pas : Extremely simple demonstration of the GetImage and PutImage procedures. SampColl.pas : a sample program displaying the use of collections. Screens.pas : A sample showing the saving of the video screen into 'pages' and displaying. Serial.pas : Setting and Reading the serial number of a disk. SeqSrch.pas : A demonstration of sequential searching through a list. Scrn2Txt.pas : A sample showing the saving of the video screen (in text mode) to a text file. ShellSrt.pas : A demonstration of the Shell Sort algorithm. SngLnk1.pas : a sample program showing the usage of a sorted single linked list. SortColl.pas : a sample program displaying the use of TSortedCollections. STDM1.pas : This program shows how to display every nth character in a string. Streams.pas : a sample program showing the usage streams. QuickSrt.pas : A demonstration of the Quick Sort algorithm. Pascal related Text : Directiv.txt : This file is a listing of the Compiler Directives for Borland Pascal 7.0. Error.txt : This file is a listing of the Compiler and Runtime errors for Borland Pascal 7.0. RunTime.txt : This file is a listing of all the standard Procedures and Functions within Borlad Pascal 7.0 This list is broken down alphabetically by name. RunTime2.txt : This file is a listing of all the standard Procedures and Functions within Borlad Pascal 7.0 This list is broken down alphabetically by the unit in which each are found. ### Creating pages manually If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features. ### Authors and Contributors You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub. ### Support or Contact Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
